ContentStructure.title: Information Security Awareness Quiz Security New Year
Take our Security Quiz to test your knowledge.   Click on Begin to start.
Begin Trigger this button to go to the next slide
Brought to you by the Information Security Branch  Office of the Chief Information Officer
1.  What top movie name for 2017 made the list of the “worst passwords” of the year?

Correct - Answer:  B  In its annual listing of the worst passwords, derived from stolen credentials, password management security company Splash Data found “starwars” as #16 on the top 25 list. (#1 is “123456” and #2 is “password”.) Hackers know that people use popular culture for passwords and their tools scan for them.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  In its annual listing of the worst passwords, derived from stolen credentials, password management security company Splash Data found “starwars” as #16 on the top 25 list. (#1 is “123456” and #2 is “password”.) Hackers know that people use popular culture for passwords and their tools scan for them. . Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: 2.  With years spent analyzing password creation and management, what is the one factor that security researchers agree is the most important to evade hackers?

Correct - Answer:  C  Hackers have special password ‘cracking’ tools, most of them for free, that use algorithms to crack passwords at amazing speed. These tools will recognize patterns, names, and phrases, which is why complexity and cleverness are important. The longer the password, however, the harder it will be to crack.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  C  Hackers have special password ‘cracking’ tools, most of them for free, that use algorithms to crack passwords at amazing speed. These tools will recognize patterns, names, and phrases, which is why complexity and cleverness are important. The longer the password, however, the harder it will be to crack.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: 3.  You should not carry your PIN for your credit or debit card on you, but if you choose to do so, keep it totally separated from your card.

Correct - Answer:  A  If someone steals your card and gets your PIN along with it, banks in Canada will argue that they do not have to credit you for charges you claim are fraudulent because the person who used the card had the PIN. Besides, without the PIN, they can’t use the card!  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  If someone steals your card and gets your PIN along with it, banks in Canada will argue that they do not have to credit you for charges you claim are fraudulent because the person who used the card had the PIN. Besides, without the PIN, they can’t use the card!  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.text: 3.  You should not carry your PIN for your credit or debit card on you, but if you choose to do so, keep it totally separated from your card.

ContentStructure.title: 4.  Some very large data breaches (e.g. Equifax) happened because needed software or security patches were not applied. What can you do as a user?

Correct - Answer:  D  Those hackers are really on top of things!  That means that everyone else has to be vigilant and responsible to protect their information and devices from people who have lots of resources and time to find ways to commit computer crimes. Accept updates when they become available.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  D  Those hackers are really on top of things!  That means that everyone else has to be vigilant and responsible to protect their information and devices from people who have lots of resources and time to find ways to commit computer crimes. Accept updates when they become available.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: is a popular adage for the idea that it is impossible to get something for nothing. What about all those free online services and apps?

Correct - Answer:  C  Those long and detailed User Agreements that we say “yes” to detail the information that the company is collecting from us, like our location, our habits and our preferences that are used for analytical purposes to ‘improve their service’ and to sell us things. That information is often given to third parties as well. Nothing online is without an associated cost.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  C  Those long and detailed User Agreements that we say “yes” to detail the information that the company is collecting from us, like our location, our habits and our preferences that are used for analytical purposes to ‘improve their service’ and to sell us things. That information is often given to third parties as well. Nothing online is without an associated cost.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: 6.  Location services, GPS and photo tagging are features created to make smartphones more versatile, so they should be “On” all the time.

Correct - Answer:  B  It is true that they provide versatility but false that they should be left on. These features should be turned off where possible, unless and until you need to use them. Otherwise, others can be tracking you and gathering information you may not even know you are sharing.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  It is true that they provide versatility but false that they should be left on. These features should be turned off where possible, unless and until you need to use them. Otherwise, others can be tracking you and gathering information you may not even know you are sharing.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 6.  Location services, GPS and photo tagging are features created to make smartphones more versatile, so they should be “On” all the time.

ContentStructure.title: 7. “Tailgating” for security purposes refers to someone walking through a secured door or gate that was opened by someone with a badge or code. When you swipe your badge and someone follows closely behind you, what should you do?
Ask them to swipe their badge

answer.title: Ask them to swipe their badge

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  A  Even with people we recognize, we should ask them to swipe their badge at the secured door entry. When they do, there is a record of when they entered, which is important in an emergency or if there is a serious incident. If it’s a stranger, ask if that person has a badge. Security is everyone’s responsibility.   Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  Even with people we recognize, we should ask them to swipe their badge at the secured door entry. When they do, there is a record of when they entered, which is important in an emergency or if there is a serious incident. If it’s a stranger, ask if that person has a badge. Security is everyone’s responsibility.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 7. “Tailgating” for security purposes refers to someone walking through a secured door or gate that was opened by someone with a badge or code. When you swipe your badge and someone follows closely behind you, what should you do?

ContentStructure.title: 8.  Communicating with someone via webcam creates a false sense of privacy, like being in a room together. If asked to take your clothes off in an online relationship, is it okay to take that small step toward intimacy?
It is more important to protect yourself

answer.title: It is more important to protect yourself

ContentStructure.title: It is okay, what could go wrong?

answer.title: It is okay, what could go wrong?

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer: A  While it may seem like it is just the two of you and it is safe, the reality can be very different. That simple risky act of exposing one’s body or being sexual has led to blackmail, bullying, shaming, and tragic consequences including suicide. There is no guarantee of privacy on the Internet and no guarantee that the person is who they claim.   Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  A  While it may seem like it is just the two of you and it is safe, the reality can be very different. That simple risky act of exposing one’s body or being sexual has led to blackmail, bullying, shaming, and tragic consequences including suicide. There is no guarantee of privacy on the Internet and no guarantee that the person is who they claim.   Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

ContentStructure.title: 9.  Social media is all about connecting with other people. To do that, you need to share information and personal details about yourself.
True, you can trust these sites

answer.title: True, you can trust these sites

ContentStructure.title: You can limit what you share

answer.title: You can limit what you share

ContentStructure.title: Social media sites are dangerous places.

answer.title: Social media sites are dangerous places.

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer: B  Cyber criminals and bad people in general know how to take pieces of information and use them in ways that trusting individuals would not have considered. If you would not print it in your local newspaper, don’t put it online! Think about the risks and the benefits and then make choices that respect and protect yourself because social media sites can be dangerous places.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer: B  Cyber criminals and bad people in general know how to take pieces of information and use them in ways that trusting individuals would not have considered. If you would not print it in your local newspaper, don’t put it online! Think about the risks and the benefits and then make choices that respect and protect yourself because social media sites can be dangerous places.  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.

question.title: Multiple Choice
question.text: 9.  Social media is all about connecting with other people. To do that, you need to share information and personal details about yourself.

ContentStructure.title: 10.  Constantly hearing about security threats is like listening to bad news on TV – people can decide to just tune it out and trust that things will be okay. Can the average user be security aware and still enjoy the benefits of the online world?
Better to ignore what you can’t change

answer.title: Better to ignore what you can’t change

ContentStructure.title: Better to be an informed user

answer.title: Better to be an informed user

ContentStructure.title: Better to be afraid and limit tech use

answer.title: Better to be afraid and limit tech use

ContentStructure.title: Correct - Answer:  B  This is a security awareness quiz after all. We want tech users to understand how they can have some control by learning the best practices to protect their information – at work, at home and on the go. Watch out for phishing links and attachments. Use different passwords for your accounts. Watch what you agree to. Learn your device Settings. Enjoy the online world by being security aware. Happy New Year!  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.

Incorrect - Answer:  B  This is a security awareness quiz after all. We want tech users to understand how they can have some control by learning the best practices to protect their information – at work, at home and on the go. Watch out for phishing links and attachments. Use different passwords for your accounts. Watch what you agree to. Learn your device Settings. Enjoy the online world by being security aware. Happy New Year!  Click anywhere or press ‘y’ to continue.
You must answer the question before continuing.
